highlights: Revamped dev environment to improve productivity (Workstation)
Built system to monitor repo best practices (Repo Health)
Uncovered areas to improve automated repo management (Scaffold/Origin)
Mentored junior engineers on design patterns and solution architecture
Team co-lead, mentored junior engineers
Proposed, planned, and developed dev tool to replace legacy tool (OneCli)
Drove key initiatives to optimize Ci performance through code pruning and optimizations
Established SLO on CI success rate using DataDog
Improved CI build times by leveraging dependency caching for legacy monoliths
Took full ownership of dev tool (IKE)
Led initiative to migrate CI from TeamCity to GitHub Actions
Transitioned CI and Production to AWS ECR from self-hosted Docker Registry
Incorporated AWS Secrets Manager into the dev and CI environments
Collaborated with Director of Development on proposals to improve project development
Created reusable libraries to simplify backend development
Designed micro and macro level olution architecture for incoming projects
Implemented API-first driven development
Incorporated Ci system using TeamCity, Docker, and F# Fake build system
Introduced Functional Programming concepts to improve code quality
Handled designing and developing multiple in-flight projects
Developed backend solutions for projects
Led initiative to adopt Docker and Kubernetes

projects.name: Workstation in the Cloud
projects.description: Workstation is a dev tool for spinning up the JumpCloud stack in a local environment. This project transitioned dev to a hybrid environment by introducing a cloud component. As a result, engineers' productivity improved as their workstation performance improved.

projects.name: Repo Health
projects.description: A monitor for tracking how well repositories are adhering to best practices such as codeowners file configured, branch protection rules, using latest tooling version, using latest version of common libraries, etc. This information was pushed to DataDog as metrics and monitors were configured for high priority practices.

projects.name: OneCli
projects.description: A dev tool designed to replace the legacy toolchain, IKE. This was a modular toolchain designed to support: engineers, devops, CI, and automation. Engineers could build, test, and deploy there services. Devops could connect to production, scale services, and perform database operations. CI and automation tested services, handled auxiliary PR checks, and released projects when triggered. Custom modules was also supported.

projects.name: GitHub Actions CI
projects.description: Modernized CI with GitHub Actions. Pipeline was modeled after legacy TeamCity pipeline to simplify transition. Used a central repository as home for custom actions in order to scale solution across 50+ repositories.
